person_say: I’ve been procrastinating on my report and don’t know how to start. Are there any ways to improve my efficiency?
animal_say: Bzzzz! What feelings come up for you when you think about starting this report?

person_say: I feel a mix of anxiety and frustration. I worry about not being good enough or running out of time, which makes it even harder to get started.
animal_say: Bzzzz! Does your anxiety stem from the fear of failing at this task or from expectations you feel?

person_say: I think it comes from both. I'm scared of failing because I want to do well, but there’s also pressure to meet expectations, especially with grades.
animal_say: Bzzzz! You have a Fear of Failure. Try breaking the task into smaller pieces; it can lessen the pressure!

person_say: That sounds like a good idea! I could break my report into sections and focus on one at a time. It might make it feel less overwhelming!
animal_say: Buzz! Absolutely! Set mini-deadlines for each section to keep you on track!

person_say: I like that! If I set mini-deadlines for each section, it could help me stay organized and motivated. Thanks for the tip!
animal_say: Buzz buzz! You’re welcome! Let me know if you need more support!

person_say: I will! Thanks for being so helpful! I feel a bit more confident about tackling my report now.
animal_say: Buzz buzz! I'm thrilled to hear that! Go out there and tackle that report!
